sooooo... 

1) the USB drive doesnt work when I try to install it. I used PowerIso to write the CD data to a USB drive. When I go to the boot menu and select the USB / Removable Media option, the screen goes black with that little grey line forever blinking at the top left corner of the screen. 

2) I tried to solve the above problem by using a 700MB disc. Some of the folders had an error when copying to the disc, like the Extra Programs. I cant remember the rest... but I pop the disc to my xp and the Windows XP Installation popped up. I cant seem to get the right product key. Of all things... lol. I know your the programmer... but any help would be greatly appreciated.

First you should read the Read Me file.

1. Use WinToFlash and not a ISO editor to install Windows XP from an USB flash driver.
2. Clean your CD-ROM drive or use a working one that's not 4 years old or try to burn the CD at a slow speed.
3. This Windows XP is not for Upgrading you must make a clean installation on a formatted Hard disk drive or Partition.

All this you could find in the Read Me file.
